version_description:
This release of ADP Mobile includes support for iPhone 6 and iPhone 6+.
We've also made bug fixes and performance improvements based on user feedback.
Please continue to help us improve by using the feedback option under Settings in the ADP Mobile app.

This release of ADP Mobile includes support for iPhone 6 and iPhone 6+.
We've also made bug fixes and performance improvements based on user feedback.
Please continue to help us improve by using the feedback option under Settings in the ADP Mobile app.

ADP Mobile Solutions is now an Universal App, offering a consistent user experience across all iOS devices. The app provides the same features and usability whether on iPhone or iPad using iOS 7 or higher.

We’ve made enhancements to the Timecard feature to reduce searching and scrolling for more efficient timecard entry. Improved iPad Pro support now allows for full-screen viewing throughout the app. Further bug fixes and improvements, such as cache reset functionality which restores the app to the original downloaded state, enhance performance and user experience.

ADP Mobile Solutions is now an Universal App, offering a consistent user experience across all iOS devices. The app provides the same features and usability whether on iPhone or iPad using iOS 7 or higher.

We’ve made enhancements to the Timecard feature to reduce searching and scrolling for more efficient timecard entry. Improved iPad Pro support now allows for full-screen viewing throughout the app. Further bug fixes and improvements, such as cache reset functionality which restores the app to the original downloaded state, enhance performance and user experience.

ADP Mobile Solutions now has an updated look and feel, an easier to read interface, and an engaging display.   Timecard users now have access to a quick entry keypad with all of the special characters necessary to enter time on the go.  Employees no longer have to shuffle through multiple keyboards to enter time duration.  Coming soon, eligible users will see an enhanced Retirement view that provides better ways to visualize their portfolio.

ADP Mobile Solutions now has an updated look and feel, an easier to read interface, and an engaging display. Employees no longer have to shuffle through multiple keyboards to enter time duration.  Coming soon, eligible users will see an enhanced Retirement view that provides better ways to visualize their portfolio.
This releases contains some enhancements and bug fixes.  Also, there will be an improved user experience for select employees whose companies offer Retirement Services via ADP Mobile Solutions.
This releases contains some enhancements and bug fixes.  Also, there will be an improved user experience for select employees whose companies offer Retirement Services via ADP Mobile Solutions.

With this release, you can switch to other apps while remaining logged in to ADP Mobile. For your security, ADP Mobile will close after five minutes of inaction. Certain features, like Registration, will display in a web view within the app for easier navigation and use. Eligible users with the enhanced Retirement feature will see load time improvements.

Support for 3D Touch shortcuts allows users faster, easier access to their most commonly accessed features on iPhone 6s or higher devices with iOS 9. Additional performance enhancements for all supported iOS devices.

This release of ADP Mobile includes an improved Pay experience featuring a detailed graphic breakdown of your statement and the ability to compare two pay statements. Eligible users will see an updated look and feel in the Schedule, Time Off and ALINE Card features. In addition, this release contains performance enhancements and bug fixes.

This release of ADP Mobile includes a new Things To Do tile on the dashboard, allowing quick access to what you need to do next. The watch app contains a new Demo so you can view some upcoming features ahead of time. We also added some bug fixes and minor improvements.

This release of ADP Mobile provides general usability enhancements, performance improvements, and bug fixes. Some users of the Access Clock feature will have the ability to sync punches on demand, add transfers with labor levels, and use a new QR code feature to fill-in labor levels automatically. This is also our first release of ADP Mobile stickers, which are available to all users. Have fun using them!
This release of ADP Mobile includes some visual enhancements to the Offline Punch screen, bug fixes, and other improvements.

This release of ADP Mobile introduces NFC (Near Field Communication) capability to the Access Clock feature. To make transferring easier, you can now pre-fill all of your labor levels to an NFC tag that you acquire. When you're ready to transfer, scan the tag and all of your labor levels will automatically be filled in for you. This functionality will be available for some Time users in the U.S. This release also includes bug fixes, enhanced security, and general usability improvements.

This release of ADP Mobile will offer QR and NFC capabilities to certain Time users that use transfers while punching. This release also introduces a new Map Locator feature that displays the location of a Time user relative to their approved geofenced location. There are also bug fixes.

This release of ADP Mobile provides general usability enhancements, performance improvements, and resolves particular crash issues. Certain users will have access to new Chat and Case Management features.

This release of ADP Mobile includes a new feature called Return To Workplace. Some users might be asked to answer quick questions as your employer prepares to invite employees back on-site. Your responses could help keep your workplace healthy and safe as your employer makes decisions on scheduling people to return. This release also includes bug fixes and general usability enhancements.

This release of ADP Mobile includes the ability to use the Access Clock feature on the watch. An improvement to the Access Clock feature is also included that allows punches to automatically sync when the user has connectivity. This auto-sync enhancement for Access Clock applies to both the phone and the watch. This release also includes usability enhancements, bug fixes, and resolves a crash that some users were experiencing.

This release of ADP Mobile provides general usability enhancements, performance improvements, and resolves particular crash issues. All Access Clock/Offline Punch users will see a new entry button on the login screen called Quick Clock. Use this button to access the existing Access Clock/Offline Punch feature. ADP Branding was also added to the login screens.

This release also addresses a crash that some users were experiencing when trying to print using iOS 14. It also contains additional bug fixes and minor usability improvements.
